Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, worn, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of at least seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394854) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394854)
